node.title: CST_Storage_20
node.doctext:
This is a storage node for CST reviews. Reviews are moved her from our working area in [CST_Chat].

This archive begins on 03/19/2006, When it's full we'll move to [CST_Storage_21].

See also CST Storage collabs [CST_Storage_1|1] - [CST_Storage_20|20].

Batch Processed 03/19/2006 part 2

Writeup Title:[Ten Little Cannibals]
Author:[EElizard]
Reviewer: [XWiz]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 80%
Compliance Assessment: No
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2006-02-02@16:40 [jessicapierce] says Can you check [Ten Little Cannibals], please?
Track was published in the seventies and remains copyrighted. Deleted with message 'This node has been removed because of [e2 copyright changes].

Writeup Title:See notes
Author:[spacklequeen]
Reviewer: [XWiz] ,[Lometa]
Public domain?: See notes
Original Author's Permission received?: See notes
Quoted content less than 33%: Unknown
Compliance Assessment: See editor notes
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2006-02-02@21:55 [Walte]r says As you may have noticed I'm going through the work of [spacklequeen] and there's a lot... a LOT... of Caroliner lyrics which say "Noded with permission" and "copyright 1883" which seem to me like conveniently unverifiable statements.
2006-02-13@12:55 [XWiz] says I've gone through [spacklequeen] 's nodes. The majority of the lyrics say they're copyright compliant. I've not removed any of the very low reputation ones, and I've held my hand on the editing front having realised it's not my place to change 'yr' 'your', even if it does annoy me. :) I also started to replace the '&' with '&' for html compliance and then realised I wasn't sure if there was any point or if it was even my business to. I did msg spacklequeen on each writeup I edited. You'll have noticed my question about Duane Dibbley 's account; if you've any advice or info to offer on spackle or dibbley I'd be delighted to hear it. Thanks!
Hello [Walter], [Xwiz] and I did a node audit on spaklequeen’s account and have left the ones that say that lyrics were used with permission because it is E2’s policy in the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material |FAQ] at this time. Everything looks up to snuff and if you find more or have questions about what remains please don’t hesitate to ask. Thank you! ([lometa|lo])
I see here that you comment that you sent for permission to node lyrics and the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material |FAQ] at this time says we have to accept the noders word. I was wondering if you ever heard from them? ([lometa|lo] to spacklequeen re her last [January 31, 2001|day log])
Hey there we’ve got a problem going on with [spacklequeen]’s account. She has a large number of lyrics that say they are noded with permission yet her last [January 31, 2001|day log] notes that she had not heard from one band. [Walter], [Xwiz] and I have all audited her account. I’m going to hand off the decision about what to do to you. There will be an evaluation in [CST_Chat] very soon. If you would be so kind to add your comments to it I would really appreciate it. ([lometa|lo] to [GrouchyOldMan|GOM])
2006-03-12@12:56 [spacklequeen] says thanks for all the messages, but i can not give more than 33%. "copyright" isn't in my dictionary. I'm in the process of having all my nodes killed. ..... .. cheers.
I’m so sorry to hear that you have decided to remove your work from E2. I enjoyed reading it as I worked my way through your account and would like to ask if you would please reconsider this [E2 Nuke request|request]. E2 is so lacking in lyrics and it would be a shame to loose all of the hard work you’ve contributed.

Writeup Title:[Dusty Old Dust]
Author:[spacklequeen]
Reviewer: [XWiz] amd [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 89%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2006-02-11@3:34 [Walter] says [Dusty Old Dust]- Woody Guthrie tune.
Sorry, this violates copyright. If you expand on it or provide commentary please let an editor know so it can be checked for copyright compliancy. ([XWiz])

Writeup Title:[Grunka Lunka]
Author:[waverider37]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 30%
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2006-02-07@8:12 [Pint] says [Grunka Lunka]. Any thoughts?
Hello waverider37, Unfortunately because of copyrights E2 cannot keep copyrighted lyrics in its database unless they meet [fair use]. At this time the quoted lyrics are 48% of the write up and the minimum standard is 33%. Adding more original content about the song or show can bring it up to the standards. I will be more than happy to help. Please let me know what you would like to do by next [February 17,2006|Friday]. If I don’t hear from you by then I’ll assume you don’t want to update it and it will be removed. Kind regards.
2006.02.11 at 08:50 [waverider37] says I never knew about that. Unfortunately I will not have much time to do anything about it before Friday, is it possible to give me an extension?
Sure! Can you give me a time frame?
2006.02.12 at 04:21 [waverider37] says I should have it done by next weekend... Give me until Monday, UTC.
2006.02.12 at 04:46 [waverider37] says Actually, never mind. I found time. Is that enough to be acceptable?
ah geez it’s right at 35%. Two or three sentences are all that’s needed. How about adding a small blurb about which season it appeared in and who the writer is. Here’s a [http://tinyurl.com/7lac5 |web site] (Wiki) with some info about that.
2006-02-12@5:44 [waverider37] says I can handle two or three. Be done in a jiffy.
Hooray! It’s at 30% Congratulations! You may append this hardlink [CST Approved] . I knew you could do it!
2006-02-12@6:00 waverider37 says /me shouts YO! in celebration.

Writeup Title:[Ready or Not]
Author:[borgo]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: lyric count exceeds guidelines.
Compliance Assessment:No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2006-01-28@16:37 borgo says hi, it’s me being a pest again - can you or one of your compadres take a look at [Ready or Not] and let me know it cuts the mustard
Hi again borgo. The lyric count for this write up is 308 and the cut off is 250. What would you like to do?
2006-01-28@17:00 borgo says I'l like to change copyright law but since that seems out of the realm of possibility, I'll re-work in the next day or so and get back to you - is that ok?
Sure' nuff. Let me know when it's ready and I'll be happy to review it agains:)
Lo to borgo --"Any idea when you'll have yhis updated?" (02/10/2006)
[borgo] says re [Ready Or Not] dang, it slipped my mind - mebbe in the next day or two or three -if I can't come up with something I'll just kill it...
okay:) Lemme know what you decide so I can close out the CST evaluation on it.
2006-02-16@16:09 [borgo] says re [Ready or Not] - I killed it - couldn't make coherent without the entire song - oh well...
Okay thanks! One idea might be to write and ask permission to post all the lyrics within the context of the write up. A lot of times they are more than happy to let writers do that.

Batch Processed 05/03/2006

Writeup Title:[archy and mehitabel]
Author:[Quizro]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: NA
Original Author's Permission received?: NA
Quoted content less than 33%: NA
Compliance Assessment: NA
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:
2006-04-19@0:11 [jessicapierce] says [archy and mehitabel] would really benefit from some original content. It’s nukeable as-is, but I'd much rather see it fleshed out... but I know the author & he's none too active these days. Anyway at the very least, some of those linked poems are surely in violation. Pip pip
Hello Quizro, Unfortunately all the poems that are hardlinked in this write up went by the wayside during the [E2 copyright changes]. If you would like to update it and resubmit it with some original content E2 sure would be all the better for it.
Hi Jessica, After checking all the links all of the poems in [archy and mehitabel] had already been removed from the database. I deleted [Quizo]s and encouraged him to update it.

Writeup Title:[rivers]
Author:[ Garryn]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: (Y/N/Unknown)
Original Author's Permission received?: (Y/N/NA)
Quoted content less than 33%: (Y/N/NA)
Compliance Assessment: (Y/N)
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2006-04-19@22:49 [Albert Herring] says [rivers] needs checking for copyright compliance (and database value). The original poem (1916ish) is out of copyright, but this translation is uncredited and undated and to be found in various other places on the web.
Hello Garryn, Unfortunately the translation of this poem was done by author Jon Silkin and fist published in his book “The Penguin Book of First World War Poetry: Revised Edition.” Oftentimes a poem will be in public domain in its original language, however the translators of the poem create their own copyright. If you would like to update this and resubmit it you may want to read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material].

Writeup Title: [DJs]
Author: [Glowing Fish]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: No
Original Author's Permission received?: No
Quoted content less than 33%: No
Compliance Assessment: No
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2006.04.18 at 01:58 Lometa says Please evaluate DJs by Glowing Fish.
Hi there, Bad news I'm afraid. This writeup doesn't appear to be compliant with the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material|E2 Copyright Policy]. For fair use compliance the quote should be less than 250 words total and 33% or less of the total wordcount. You're at 58% & 313 words. If you have permission to post it here, or believe that it's in the Public Domain let me know. If I don't hear from you I will remove the writeup. Cheers.
[GlowingFish|Mutant Pescado] sez: 2006-04-21 (59.8 min) Glowing Fish says Oh, is that still there? Did you count the lyrics that are in the public domain? How many of the lyrics are in the public domain? Did you count the words in the softlinks as part of the word total? And, did you count the words after I added a paragraph this morning? And, do you realize that I like it when I can stop feeling bad about what happens to the culture of, mmm, you don't have words. Have fun.
[GrouchyOldMan|VisiblyAgingAndIrritable] responds: /msg Glowing_Fish Words? I have lots of words. For example supercilious is a word that comes to mind when I've put in the time to try and address a problem and I get a [Know where you are, don't be a fool|foolish] loopy answer. Your wu sleeps with the [glowing|fishes].
Luminous Minnow sez: 2006-04-21 (2.7 min) Glowing Fish says I did add another paragraph in there. I don't have a calculator. It was a silly writeup, anyway. But...ah, well. No time now.
GOM relents slightly: If you care to update it for compliance, I'll be glad to check it before you repost. Put it on your ScratchPad and let me know. Cheers.
Tc = 652, Tq = 314, %q= 48%

Hello twic, Just a note to let you know that [The Custodian]’s write up is being removed because of the [E2 copyright changes]. This will leave the readers that come across this write up in the future wondering about its content and the downvotes will accumulate over time. To off set the down voting one idea would be to update it by expanding on the explication you have begun about the lyrics under [fair use]. If you are interested in doing that there are some guidelines in the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material]. There are many examples of this in the database. One noder that does an excellent job on lyrics and storytelling in [borgo]. Another noder who does exceedingly well is [dannye]. You may want to read through several of their write ups to get a feel for it and come up with something completely novel on your own.

If you would like a fresh start there is always the option to remove the write up with a [E2 Nuke Request|deletion request]. It’s tough learning the ropes here and I encourage you to hang in there. Don’t hesitate to ask for help from anyone with an @ or $ by their names and a shout out to the cat box will always lead to support from most of the users. If you have any questions or concerns please feel free to message me!
